subject: Law
title: Conditions: Precedent, Concurrent, Subsequent
description: Learn Conditions: Precedent, Concurrent, Subsequent in one minute.

hook.text: You'll buy a houseâ€”if the inspection passes. That 'if' is a condition precedent. No pass, no deal.

buildup.text: Conditions are events that must occur (or not occur) before a party's duty to perform is triggered.

discovery.text: A condition precedent must happen first. Concurrent conditions happen simultaneously. Subsequent ones end a duty.

twist.text: Courts prefer to interpret ambiguous terms as promises, not conditionsâ€”breach of a promise gives a remedy.

climax.text: Failure of a condition precedent excuses performance entirely. No one breachedâ€”the deal just doesn't activate.

punchline.text: Conditions are the switches. They turn obligations on and off.

quiz.question: What is a condition precedent?
options: An event that ends a contract
An event that must occur before a duty to perform arises
